subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobson welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is I don't like to admit it but I
have road rage I hate sitting in traffic
I hate how other people drive I get so
angry that other drivers that I'm afraid
that one of these days I'm going to get
out of my car and hurt someone how can I
calm down when I'm driving well what can
I say to you that if this is the only
rage you have in the road rage and
there's no rage that spills over into
your personal life to your marital life
or any other part of your life you're
not that bad I've been driving the
number of years myself and I see these
people they suddenly feel that they were
cut off and they make it a real
obsession for the next hour to three
hours to make sure to get back in the
person that cut them off even if they
went off the exit I heard someone who
had road rage you actually chased the
guy off the exit just to cut them off
and then he went back onto the highway
maybe they have to take a little sense
of humor approach to this and maybe let
out the event in your car just make sure
you don't hurt yourself or hurt anyone
else the same time if we want to analyze
it a little deeper let's look at the
reasons that a person may have such rage
the end of the day it's such a petty
think you're dealing with people that
are in the road with you that you don't
know they don't even intentionally mean
to hurt you in any way even if you think
that they cut you off and so on and yet
you get into this uncontrollable rage
where you must get even similar to you
have sports fans that they literally
could become violent when the other team
that opposes their their home team is
winning the game is it perhaps a way to
release other anger and and the rage
that we may have is it a sense of lack
of control in your life and here
suddenly it's being directly challenged
is it some other form of insecurity that
this is trying to compensate all the
above may be the case
and then the day we are human beings and
some of us have quirks some of us in the
most ridiculous ways express our
passions so it's a good opportunity if
you're asking the question to laugh at
yourself a bit ask yourself why is is
the case and hopefully maybe it will
expose something new that you haven't
thought of before but clearly rage has
no place in any person's life now when
someone actually hurt you or betrays you
and it's really hurt you there too there
are solutions not to become furious and
angry but that's a different discussion
definitely not in the area which doesn't
have true consequences if you actually
cannot control something and there are
other factors so it's important to also

use some unresolved issues thank you for
